text.text: How are charges assigned to accounting periods in ZOLL Billing?

text: ZOLL Billing automatically records all posted charges, payments, and adjustments to the appropriate monthly accounting period. Managers can use the information in the accounting periods to reconcile billing charges, transactions, and adjustments with monthly closing reports.

text.text: What happens to charges if I work on a claim in a different period than its date of service?

text: If you work on an October 15th claim in November after the October accounting period is closed, the charges will go into the November period with an October date.

text.text: Can you explain how payments are allocated to accounting periods?

text: Payments are based on the deposit date. If you are posting a payment for a deposit date of October 15th, it will go in the October period until that period is closed.

text.text: What determines the period in which a payment will be placed?

text: If the accounting period in which the transaction was posted is still open, the transaction will reverse in that period. If not, the adjustment will happen in the next open period.

text.text: How are adjustments handled in terms of accounting periods?

text: Adjustments are based on the posted date. If you post an adjustment for the October 15th claim on November the 5th, it will go into the next open period.

text.text: What is the basis for assigning adjustments to a specific period?

text: If the accounting period in which the transaction was posted is still open, the transaction will reverse in that period. If not, the adjustment will happen in the next open period.

text.text: Is there a difference in how charges, payments, and adjustments are treated in terms of accounting periods?

text: Charges are based on the date of service. For example, if you have an October 15th claim, as long as the October period is open the charges for that claim will go into that period. However, if you work an October 15th claim in November after the October accounting period is closed, the charges will go into the November period with an October date.

text.text: What happens if I post a payment or adjustment for a period that is already closed?

text: If you delete a payment with a period that has already been closed, the system will make the negative adjustment in the next open period.

text.text: Can you clarify how the system handles adjustments based on the posted date?

text: If you post an adjustment for the October 15th claim on November the 5th, it will go into the next open period. Because adjustments are based on posted date, most of the time you will not have adjustments in different periods.
